title: Timeline - Usage Examples
description: Create vertical timelines for company history, product roadmaps, event agendas, process steps

examples.name: Company History Timeline (Alternating)
examples.description: Zigzag timeline showing company milestones with icons
examples.visualDescription: Vertical timeline with alternating left/right cards, center line with icons, start marker (rocket icon) and end marker (flag icon), purple accent color

examples.useCase: Company history, brand story, about pages, milestone showcases
notes: Alignment='center' creates zigzag effect with alternating RPosition

RPosition alternates: right, left, right, left for zigzag
Rnone='icon' requires Ricon with FontAwesome class
StartPin/EndPin add decorative markers to timeline endpoints

examples.name: Product Roadmap (One-Sided with CTAs)

examples.useCase: Product roadmaps, release schedules, feature announcements, development timelines
notes: Alignment='left' puts timeline line on left, all items on right (one-sided)
isAnim=true enables scroll-triggered animation of timeline line
animColor defines color of animated progress line (matches brand purple)
RButton=true adds CTA button to each timeline item
RBtnText is button label, RUrl defines link destination
Rnone='image' requires Rimg object with url and id
StartPin/EndPin='text' uses text labels instead of icons

RcTitle is job title/position name

Company logos should be square (100x100px recommended) for consistent pin sizing

examples.useCase: Simple project timelines, blog post summaries, quick milestone lists, minimal designs
notes: Rnone='none' removes icons/images from timeline pins (just dots)
No StartPin/EndPin defined = minimal endpoint styling
All RPosition='right' with Alignment='left' = one-sided layout
Perfect for content-focused timelines without visual distractions
Faster rendering (no icon fonts or images to load)

examples.useCase: Complex content timelines, technical documentation, feature comparison timelines, detailed specifications
notes: CRITICAL: RcHTML overrides Rdes field (custom HTML takes precedence)
Use RcHTML for complex formatting: tables, styled lists, custom layouts
Inline styles required (no external CSS classes in HTML)
Sanitization applies (scripts, iframes, dangerous tags removed)
Keep HTML semantic and accessible (proper headings, lists, tables)
Test HTML output carefully (may affect responsive layout)
For simple text, use Rdes instead of RcHTML

styleGuide.style-2: Alternative timeline style (check plugin for visual differences)

validationRules.RContent: Required, array of timeline items, minimum 1 item recommended
validationRules._key: Required for each RContent item, must be unique, use sequential strings: '1', '2', '3'...
validationRules.RcTitle: Required, main heading for timeline item
validationRules.Ricon: Required when Rnone='icon', must be valid FontAwesome class (e.g., 'fas fa-star')
validationRules.Rimg: Required when Rnone='image', object with {url, id}
validationRules.RButton: Boolean, if true requires RBtnText and RUrl
validationRules.RUrl: Required when RButton=true, object with {url, target, nofollow}
validationRules.Rfimage: Required when RcType='image', object with {url, id}
validationRules.animColor: Required when isAnim=true, must be valid hex color (e.g., '#667eea')

warnings: CRITICAL: Each RContent item must have unique _key (use '1', '2', '3'... not numbers)
CRITICAL: Rnone='icon' requires Ricon attribute (timeline will break without it)
CRITICAL: Rnone='image' requires Rimg object with url and id
CRITICAL: RButton=true requires both RBtnText and RUrl (button won't work without both)
Don't duplicate _key values (causes timeline items to malfunction)
Don't use RcHTML for simple text (use Rdes instead, RcHTML overrides Rdes)
Don't mix 'left' and 'right' RPosition with Alignment='left' (creates messy layout)
Max 20 timeline items recommended for performance (large timelines slow page)
FontAwesome library must be loaded for Rnone='icon' (icons won't display otherwise)
Large images in Rfimage slow page load (optimize images, use WebP format)
isAnim=true requires animColor attribute (animation won't work without color)
BGSnBg gradient applies to ALL items (can't have per-item backgrounds)
StartPin/EndPin must match available types: 'icon', 'image', 'text', or 'none'
Custom HTML in RcHTML must use inline styles (external classes won't work)
RcHTML content is sanitized (scripts, iframes, dangerous tags removed for security)
commonMistakes: Using number for _key instead of string (use '1', not 1)
Forgetting to set Ricon when Rnone='icon' (timeline pin appears broken)
Setting RButton=true but forgetting RBtnText or RUrl (button doesn't work)
Using Alignment='center' with all RPosition='right' (creates unbalanced layout)
Not alternating RPosition with center alignment (loses zigzag effect)
Using huge images in Rimg or Rfimage (page loads slowly, consider 100x100px for pins)
Mixing Rdes and RcHTML (RcHTML overrides Rdes, so Rdes content ignored)
Not providing animColor when isAnim=true (animation fails silently)
Using invalid FontAwesome classes in Ricon (icon doesn't display, shows placeholder)
Setting RcType='image' but forgetting Rfimage object (featured image doesn't show)
Creating 50+ timeline items (page becomes very slow, consider pagination)
Forgetting nofollow in RUrl when needed (SEO implications)
Using RcHTML without inline styles (styles don't apply, content looks broken)
Not escaping quotes in RcHTML (JSON parsing errors)
Using _key values that aren't sequential (harder to maintain, causes confusion)
bestPractices: Always use sequential string _key values: '1', '2', '3', '4'... for clarity
For zigzag timelines: Alignment='center' + alternate RPosition (right, left, right, left)
For one-sided timelines: Alignment='left' + all RPosition='right' (or vice versa)
Keep timeline items concise: RTitle (date/step), RcTitle (short heading), Rdes (1-2 sentences)
Choose icons that match content: fas fa-rocket (launch), fas fa-star (achievement), fas fa-check (completion)
Optimize images: Use 100x100px for Rimg pins, 400x300px for Rfimage, WebP format recommended
For event agendas: Use time in RTitle (9:00 AM), event name in RcTitle
For company history: Use year in RTitle (1995, 2000), milestone in RcTitle
For process steps: Use 'Step 1', 'Step 2'... in RTitle, action in RcTitle
Enable animation for long timelines: isAnim=true + animColor matching brand color
Use StartPin/EndPin to bookend timeline: 'Start' icon at top, 'Finish' icon at bottom
For minimal designs: Rnone='none' removes decorative pins (cleaner, faster)
For rich content: Use RcType='image' + Rfimage for visual context
For complex layouts: Use RcHTML but keep it semantic (proper tags, inline styles)
Test on mobile: Timelines stack vertically on small screens (xs breakpoint)
Limit to 10-15 items for optimal UX (users scan vertically, long timelines tire readers)
Use descriptive RBtnText: 'Learn More', 'View Details', 'Read Case Study' (not 'Click Here')
Match animColor to brand colors for consistency (#667eea purple theme example)
Use BGSnBg gradient sparingly (applies to all items, can be overwhelming)
For accessibility: Ensure color contrast in gradient backgrounds (WCAG AA: 4.5:1 ratio)
accessibilityNotes: Use semantic heading hierarchy (timeline often contains h3/h4 headings inside h2 sections)
Ensure sufficient color contrast (WCAG 2.1 AA: 4.5:1 for text, 3:1 for large text)
Provide alt text for images in Rimg and Rfimage (WordPress media library handles this)
Use descriptive link text in RBtnText ('Learn More About Our Product', not 'Click Here')
Don't rely solely on color to convey information (use icons + text, not just color)
Ensure timeline is keyboard navigable (buttons/links have focus states)
Test with screen readers (content announced in chronological order top-to-bottom)
Use proper heading levels in RcTitle (CSS styling, not <h1> in RcHTML)
Avoid text over gradient backgrounds without sufficient contrast or overlay
Ensure touch targets are at least 44x44px on mobile (buttons, links)
Use ARIA labels if timeline items have complex interactions
For custom HTML (RcHTML): Use semantic tags (ul/ol for lists, table for data)
Don't auto-play animations (isAnim is scroll-triggered, user-controlled)
Provide clear visual indication of timeline progression (line, dots, colors)
Test on mobile screen readers (VoiceOver iOS, TalkBack Android)
performanceConsiderations: Limit timeline items to 10-15 for optimal performance (20 max recommended)
Optimize images: Use WebP format, correct dimensions, compressed (TinyPNG, ImageOptim)
For Rimg pins: 100x100px max (small pins load faster)
For Rfimage featured images: 400x300px recommended (balance quality vs size)
Lazy load images in Rfimage (WordPress lazy loading enabled by default in modern themes)
Avoid heavy FontAwesome icon sets (use subset with only needed icons if possible)
isAnim=true adds scroll listener (minimal impact, but avoid if not needed)
BGSnBg gradients are CSS-based (performant, no image files needed)
Minimize RcHTML complexity (heavy HTML increases DOM size, slows rendering)
Test on mobile devices (timelines can be resource-intensive on slow connections)
Consider pagination for 20+ items (split into multiple timeline sections)
Avoid auto-playing videos in RcHTML (heavy on resources)
Use browser caching for images (WordPress handles this automatically)
Monitor Cumulative Layout Shift (CLS) when timeline loads (reserve space for images)
Test with slow 3G connection (Chrome DevTools network throttling)
Avoid embedding large iframes in RcHTML (external content slows page)
